comments:
Eclipse build 3.2M4

Plugins that are dependent upon, or make use of the Eclipse runtime compatibility plugin function, fail if the resolverMode=strict setting is used.  As a workaround, removing x-internal from the org.eclipse.core.internal.compatibility entry in the Export-Package of the org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility plugin eliminates the problem.

Removing the x-internal of the manifest is the exact contrary to what we want to do with the strict mode. Strict mode means: people respect APIs. Internal packages are not APIs therefore they should not be seen when running in strict mode.

The things that needs fixing are the plug-ins that use internal packages.

Pascal, I am in completely agreement on the use of x-internal, and in not using internal/private apis.   I was not suggesting that removal of x-internal is necessarily the fix -- I was only identifying that it allowed a workaround.

However, the issue here is about compatibility mode plugins.   If a plugin does not contain a manifest, then a manifest is generated to include org.eclipse.core.internal.compatibility.PluginActivator which is not accessible to the plugin.   Secondly, and this may be a question of product/component, but the specific plugin identified here as failing is org.eclipse.core.resources, which I may have mistakenly assumed was owned by the Platform/runtime component.

Resources is part of the Resources component.  In any event, there has been no attempt to ensure that bundles which have not moved forward to 3.0 (ie. have not moved off of the compatibility bundles or started to include manifest.mfs) would have any ability to run in strict mode.  This just was not contemplated when these plugins were written so seems very unlikely to work.  The drive here should be to get people off of compatibility.

Although this bug was opened first, there is more discussion in bug 162311 so I am marking this as a dup of that one.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 162311 ***

traces.message: The activator org.eclipse.core.internal.compatibility.PluginActivator for bundle org.eclipse.core.resources is invalid
